controlGroups._overview: Seven empty control groups (keys '1'-'7') are provided by default. Add additional numeric keys if you need more saved layouts.
editing: Use scripts/configure_control_groups.ps1 to manage groups interactively without hand-editing JSON.
Press Alt+Shift+0 (toggle overlay) followed by Alt+Shift+9 (open configurator) for the guided workflow.
The configurator populates activeDisplays/disableDisplays/audio fields based on the selections you make from the detected devices.

activeDisplays: List the display names that should remain enabled when this group is activated.
Accepts a single string (for one display) or an array of strings.
Names should match the friendly names captured in devices_snapshot.json (e.g., 'HX Armada 27').
fields.audio: Optional friendly audio device name to set as the default output (e.g., 'Speakers (Realtek(R) Audio)').
disableDisplays: Displays to explicitly turn off while this group is active.
Accepts a string or array, just like activeDisplays.
Leave empty ({} or []) to disable none explicitly.

hotkeys._overview: Hotkey descriptors use human-readable syntax like 'Left Alt+Left Shift+1' or 'Left Ctrl+Alt+F3'.
hotkeys.enableAll: Defaults to 'Left Alt+Left Shift+8'. Update to any descriptor to change the binding.
groups: Each entry maps a group key to a descriptor (e.g., 'Left Alt+Left Shift+1').
Supported modifiers: Alt, Shift, Ctrl, Win (optionally prefixed with Left/Right).
Keys may be single characters, numbers, function keys (F1-F24), or named keys (Enter, Esc, Tab, etc.).
hotkeys.openConfigurator: Defaults to 'Left Alt+Left Shift+9'. Invokes the PowerShell configurator.
hotkeys.toggleOverlay: Defaults to 'Left Alt+Left Shift+0'. Shows or hides the control-group summary overlay.

overlay.colors: Use AutoHotkey color names (e.g., Black, White, Silver) or hex strings like '#202020'.
layout: 'marginX' and 'marginY' control pixel offsets from the chosen screen edge.
'durationMs' determines how long the overlay remains visible before auto-hide (default 10000 ms = 10 seconds).
